评论详情: I was interested in this dress because of how it is made. I immediately imagined all the ways I could style it up or wear it casually. The material quality is great, and tailoring has no immediate issues I noted. I put it in the dry cleaner to be pressed and it looked even better after! I added a wide belt with it, and it looked fabulous. The fit is perfect...nothing not to like about this dress. For reference, I am 5'5", 173-175 lbs and the sleeves were not tight, and the length was just right.

I get so many compliments when I wear this dress. The pockets are what first attracted me to getting the dress. It is easy to dress up or down, depending on your accessories. However, because of the mixed and lower-quality fabric, it has become a more casual dress for me to wear with sneakers or boots. I have washed it a few times and retained the dark black color. It is so comfortable and can be worn throughout the whole year.
Nice quality material, looks and feels good. No issue seen with construction or stitching.
This is a nice dress.  It is comfortable and not too heavy.  It is a conservative look, but still fashionable.  The fit is true to size.

I wore this for the first time to a fall-themed baby shower, and it was the perfect look. The materials are comfortable and casual, yet could blend into more formal wear. Plus pockets! I am 5-7, 215 pounds, and the XL fits me perfectly, but if you're in doubt on size, I think sizing up would be wise.

评论概述: Not worth the cost. Very disappointed
评论详情: Not worth the price. The top of the dress fit good, the bottom is like a balloon and wrinkled during wear.

评论概述: Review: THE DROP Women's Barrett Short Sleeve Mixed Media Dress (Black)
评论详情: Everyone needs a little black dress. The top fabric feels lovely and lays well. It's like a thick, smooth jersey. The skirt is broadcloth. It's okay. I was surprised on the loudness of the fabric when I moved about the room. This is not a dress for a ninja. The pricepoint for me means this dress is a special occasion dress. The look and feel of this dress is more like an everyday dress. You can definitely dress it up and dress it down. The mixed media is very evident in the photos and in person. Overall, it's a meh for me. I'll wear it, but it's not my go-to black dress.

The dress has a soft cotton top. It is very form fitting. The bottom half is this crispy cotton material that is flowing. It does get very wrinkly quickly. I do love that the skirt has pockets. The only thing I don't like is where the two materials meet, it looks weird. I feel like if they included a soft belt bow or something else, it would look better.

I quite like this dress. The burnt orange color is perfect for Fall. The material of the top half has a nice stretch to it. The fabric at the skirt was a bit wrinkled but steaming took the wrinkles right out. Plus there are pockets, which I love. A good length; I’m 5’6” and it hits just a bit above my ankles.

The upper part of this dress looks like a T-shirt (knitted) while the base is broadcloth. Even though the materials are different, they match nicely in the black version of the dress. The fit of the dress is good and according to size. What would improve this dress, however, is a belt. Without a belt, it doesn't look as nice. Adding a belt really makes a big difference and elevates the style. All in all, this is a simple, everyday dress. I wouldn't wear it on a fancy occasion, but it works for going to the store and for a picnic. It is very easy to put on and take off and is very comfortable to wear.

评论概述: Beautiful dress with a great fit!
评论详情: I can’t say enough good things about this dress! The top part is a very soft knit that is very flattering. The bottom part is full and is made from a soft material that almost has a satiny finish to it. The length hits just below mid calf on my 5’6” frame. It is comfortable enough to wear all day at work, yet elegant enough to wear to dinner or a fancy party. I am so glad that I ordered it!

The top part looks nice and fits me, it’s tighter than I originally thought but will still wear it. The skirt part is honestly unexpected, it looks inexpensive and might not worth the retail price. I haven’t tried ironing it, so it might look better but I don’t usually iron clothes so I was hoping I can wear this as is. But overall, I can still think of ways styling this dress and it can be used for multiple occasions.

I Love the cut of this dress; it's a little black dress that can be super-casz or dressed way up with super-high heels.  The fabric of the skirt holds its shape nicely and the length is great on me. For reference, I'M 6 feet tall, 139 lbs, wearing a size Large. I belted it because the bodice is a little short for me, but I Love it belted.  I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because as it hung front and center in my walk-in closet, it collected a lot of lint. So I expect it will do the same when I wear it :(

This dress is absolutely beautiful! The burnt henna color is gorgeous, especially for the season. The style is flattering and it's certainly comfortable enough for long, busy days. I personally enjoy that the skirt portion is on the thinner side since there's so much fabric. It's flowy and feminine - I would highly recommend it!

评论概述: Mixed Media? More Like Mismatched Media. Sorry. Not a Fan of the Way This Dress Looks or Fits.
评论详情: I thought this dress had potential. It seemed like it would be a good basic look that could be dressed up or down. But, in reality, it is just "off." The material for the bodice is a nice stretchy knit - almost like a t-shirt on top. That part isn't so bad. But, the waist hits at an awkward point, and is not flattering. For one thing, the black on the skirt doesn't match the top. The contrast in fabric textures creates a prominent line right across the middle, which accentuates the problematic fit, and adds width. The skirt is made of a stiff poplin-type fabric that doesn't have good drape, so it stands out from your body and adds yet more width. Also WORST OF ALL, it is NOISY. It makes noise when you move. Swoosh swoosh swoosh. UGH. If only the skirt was made of the same fabric as the top, I think it would be so much better. This dress might be cuter on a smaller person, but for a plus size, it just doesn't work.

I like the two contrasting materials and tones of black, but this dress is unflattering. The issue is that the waist band is very high, starting midway between my bra band and my natural waist. It starts to flow out from that point and it adds unflattering bulk and pounds to the waist and hips, even with shapewear.  A very wide belt can help cinch at the natural waist as long as it works for where the seam aligns on you. I really like the skirt a lot, so I am thinking about just making this just a skirt with a waist band out of the stretchy material.  The top material is a stretchy material that feels nice on, is comfortable and could fit a range of sizes up top. The skirt part is pretty and flowing but prone to wrinkling.  I ordered by the measurements in the size chart and think its fits. The length is great. Due to the stretchy top material, I might have even been able to size down.

I really like this dress. I love the color, which is a cinnamon/rust, perfect for the fall. It is made of two fabrics: the top is spandex and the bottom, cotton. The style reminds me of a ballerina: the top is fitted, with short sleeves, and the bottom (with pockets) flare. All you need to do is add some fabulous jewelry and a jacket or cardigan.  There are two things I would warn you about: 1. This dress does run big. So don’t order up like I did. 2. It is long, mid calf (I’m short) so you might consider, as I have, cutting and hemming it. Overall, I am happy about this dress and plan to get a lot of wear out of it.

This dress is pretty nice, and it fits me fairly well. I have larger upper arms, and the sleeves of this were cutting into my arms so badly I had to take it off. I'll probably try to fix that sleeve issue later, but oof they hurt. The skirt looks like a wrinkled mess straight out of the bag, but I'm sure could be better with some steaming. I did like the design of this dress! It's good if you need a more modest outfit, say for the office or other such places. It fully covers the chest up to the collarbone, and the stretchy fabric of the top half doesn't squish the girls. However, this dress looks a bit cheap. It looks like I could have picked it up at Target for $25 bucks, which isn't great.

The Drop Women's Barrett, Short Sleeve dress has a tight top, and a very generous lower body cut. It is also quite long.  This is built for women who want a large skirt. And, it is also fashioned for women who are around 6 feet tall. It hit just above the ankles of our daughter-in-law who is 6' tall. And, she liked it very much. It's nice to see clothes that accommodate taller women, but can also be worn by those shorter. And, I like the color. Recommended.
This dress is so pretty. I love it. I think it’s flattering. It’s made well. It fit true to size. It’s comfortable, and it has pockets! The orange is perfect for fall. I recommend it!

This needs to be ironed/ steamed but otherwise it looks rlly good on. The material is high quality. It feels really good on. It’s also stretchy. It has pockets. Very classy. Good for a black tie event. For reference I’m wearing the size small and I’m 5”2 and 116lbs in the video. The dress is the perfect length on me. It hits exactly my ankles.

Nice “little black dress” to have on hand for those occasions when a simple but elegant dress is needed. It is not expensive but will get you through any event. Simple to wash and wear, dress up. I have a chain belt  I like to wear with it that dresses it up but keeps it classicly simple. The material is quite soft and comfortable in any weather. Travels well too. My only comment is it is quite long and I had to hem it up about 4 inches to the length pictured. That’s why 4 stars.
needed a simple but dressy enough dress to go church this drop women barrett dress is just perfect very flowing and soft to touch easy to put and take off
This dress is so cute! It’s comfortable, fits very well, machine washable and just is everything I wanted in a dress.

评论概述: Comfortable, classic style... but fabric is meh
评论详情: THE GOOD: The top half is a stretch knit in matte black, so not only will it conform to a variety of bodies, it's actually quite comfortable, like wearing a fitted T-shirt. The style is versatile and could be dressed up to formal or down to semi-formal with different accessories. I loved the way it looked with a simple belt as a focal point (pictured). It also has pockets!!  THE BAD: The skirt fabric is very disappointing. It's basically a cotton/poly broadcloth, which looks cheap and wrinkles easily. It's such an odd choice for skirt material, and I have to assume it was chosen because it's extremely inexpensive, but unfortunately it *looks* inexpensive -- more like a $30 dress than an $80 one. I'd hoped this dress would be good for travel, but the skirt wrinkles so badly that it will require steaming or ironing before wearing, so it is probably not suitcase-friendly.  ALSO NOTE: The top is opaque, but the knit is so stretchy that it can show bra bulges, so select your undergarments with care. Also, the sleeves seemed a bit longer on me than on the model. While I like having some sleeve to cover my squishy upper arms, I would have preferred them a couple of inches shorter, since they come down almost to the waist and end up making the silhouette look a bit boxy.  OVERALL: It's a nice enough dress if comfort is a priority and you're willing to iron/steam it before wearing. It has a fair amount of versatility, and the pockets are a big plus. However, I'm really not pleased with the skirt fabric, and I think that limits where I would be willing to wear it.  OFF-LABEL USE: While examining the skirt, I thought, "What if the wrinkles just weren't visible?" so I threw on a maxi skirt to see if I could use the dress as a kind of petticoat to fluff it out. It actually worked pretty well, with the knit top looking kind of like the bodysuits that this type of skirt is meant to be worn with. It might still require some ironing to get the big creases out, but I think I could make it work!  SIZING: For reference, I'm 5'4", 150 lbs., 34G bust (40" midbust) and I'm wearing a size Large.
